about

I’m currently an editorial staffer at The New Yorker, where I produce print and digital editions of the magazine and write capsule book reviews.

In past lives, I’ve researched marine invertebrates at the American Museum of Natural History, reviewed submissions to the Quarterly at McSweeney’s, and reported on infectious disease research at the National Institutes of Health.

Say hello: madelyne at alumni dot stanford dot edu.

I’m @madxiaodisease in some places and Madelyne everywhere else.

things I’m thinking about:

  • oulipo and constrained writing – the subject of an honors thesis that I started and never completed;

  • drop me a line if you’re down for a cross;

  • the MIT Puzzle Hunt will be remote next year;

  • silken tofu + century egg
